column2: idea or belief that only natural laws and forces operate in the world
time discounting; willingness to delay gratification for high future payoff
tendency to give biased explanation of people's using dispositional or situational factors
replacement term for 'modular view of the mind' due to misconceptions around the word 'modular'
how many calories you burn while doing nothing
Registry of adults who have lost 30+ lbs and kept off for 1+ years. (Includes over 10,000 adults.)
Name of the group of three amino acids that make up 35% of body's muscle mass.
The three BCAA amino acids
Amino acids required for muscles but not produced by body
network of brain activity when not doing anything in particular
being convinced someone close is an imposter, perhaps due to disruption between visual and emotional regions of brain
Droopy eyelids
Underdeveloped ears. Can result in hearing loss.
congenital disorder of movement, muscle, and posture.
Industry standard for tattoo removal. Pulses lasers in picoseconds to break up tattoo particles.
Pulse lasers in nanoseconds to heat up the tattoo ink.
Persistent, 'low-grade' depression lasting at least two years.
Genetic relatedness between individuals descended from common ancestor.
disorders where both copies of gene have mutation. Often parents are 'silent carriers', only having one copy of recessive gene.
Clear aligners that straighten teeth.
disorders caused by genetics, environment, and interaction between these.
Having extra fingers or toes.
Previously referred to as mental retardation (MR).
Disorder having an unknown cause.
Disorder that is not associated with any other physical/brain problems or genetic mutations.
Ultrasounds of the heart
Extra sound in the heart. 50% of children experience at least one.
Related to the kidneys.
Term for premature infants, a child born prior to 37 weeks.
Ability to control movements of the bowels and bladder.
Conditions that are the consequence of previous disease or injury.
Condition where there's curving of the spine.
Vision problem where the eyes are not aligned. Occurs in ~4% of children under 6yo. Can be marker for alcohol-induced birth defects.
warts are caused by this type of virus
There are around ___ strains of HPV, around __ of which cause warts
Most effective OTC cure for warts
Two most effective abrasive solutions for managing warts
These warts are usually small, smooth, and appear in larger numbers, commonly found on the face.
These warts small, rough-textured warts, commonly found on the hand.
These warts jut up, and may produce spiky, pinecone-like textures, commonly found near the nose, lips, or eyelids.
Degeneration of tendon's collagen in response to chronic overuse. Can take up to 6 months or longer to heal. About 80% of people eventually heal.
Another name for osteoarthritis.
The most common type of arthritis. Caused by normal wear and tear, the cartilage deteriorates or even disappears, resulting in bone-on-bone contact.
a painful condition caused by rubbing or pressure on a tendon, nerve, etc by adjacent structures
Shots that can relieve pain and inflammation in specific area of body. Usually injected into joints, and accompanied by local anesthetic.
Clear retainers by the creators of Invisalign. Last approx 3mo if worn throughout day, or approx 9mo if only worn at night.
